p: Motivated by the above priorities of AgInTe 2 with substoichiometric amounts of Ag in thermoelectrics, we believe that there is still some room to improve its TE performance. Therefore, in this work we prepared Ag 1- x InTe 2 (here the x value representing the Ag deficiency, and the Ag vacancy concentration (V Ag), V Ag = x/2) and then examined their TE performance in the range from room temperature (~RT) to ~820 K.
